parameters.jsCode:
const data = $input.first().json;

const fmt = (n) => (n || 0).toLocaleString('en-US');

const messageText = [
  `* Outbound Report - ${data.daily.companyCampaigns.date}*`,
  '',
  '* Yesterday*',
  `> *Company Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.daily.companyCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads contacted`,
  `> *People Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.daily.peopleCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads contacted`,
  `> *Total:* ${fmt(data.daily.total)} unique leads contacted`,
  '',
  '* All-Time*',
  `> *Company Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.allTime.companyCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads (since ${data.allTime.companyCampaigns.startDate})`,
  `> *People Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.allTime.peopleCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads (since ${data.allTime.peopleCampaigns.startDate})`,
  `> *Total:* ${fmt(data.allTime.total)} unique leads contacted`,
  '',
  `_Report generated at ${new Date().toLocaleString('en-US', { timeZone: 'America/New_York' })} ET_`
].join('\n');

return [{ json: { messageText, rawData: data } }];

const data = $input.first().json;

const fmt = (n) => (n || 0).toLocaleString('en-US');

const messageText = [
  `* Outbound Report - ${data.daily.companyCampaigns.date}*`,
  '',
  '* Yesterday*',
  `> *Company Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.daily.companyCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads contacted`,
  `> *People Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.daily.peopleCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads contacted`,
  `> *Total:* ${fmt(data.daily.total)} unique leads contacted`,
  '',
  '* All-Time*',
  `> *Company Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.allTime.companyCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads (since ${data.allTime.companyCampaigns.startDate})`,
  `> *People Campaigns:* ${fmt(data.allTime.peopleCampaigns.uniqueLeadsContacted)} unique leads (since ${data.allTime.peopleCampaigns.startDate})`,
  `> *Total:* ${fmt(data.allTime.total)} unique leads contacted`,
  '',
  `_Report generated at ${new Date().toLocaleString('en-US', { timeZone: 'America/New_York' })} ET_`
].join('\n');

return [{ json: { messageText, rawData: data } }];

parameters.content:
## Setup Instructions

**1. Replace API Key:**
In both "Get Yesterday Stats" and "Get All Time Stats" HTTP Request nodes, replace `YOUR_INSTANTLY_API_KEY` with your actual Instantly API key.

**2. Configure Slack:**
Connect your Slack credential to the "Send to Slack" node and set your target channel ID.

**3. Adjust Schedule (Optional):**
The trigger runs daily at 9:00 AM. Adjust the cron expression in the trigger node if needed.

**4. Test:**
Manually execute the workflow once to verify the data before activating.

## Setup Instructions

**1. Replace API Key:**
In both HTTP Request nodes ("Fetch Yesterday Stats" and "Fetch All Time Stats"), replace `YOUR_INSTANTLY_API_KEY` with your actual Instantly API key.

**2. Configure Slack:**
Connect your Slack credential to the "Send to Slack" node and set your target channel ID.

**3. Adjust Schedule (Optional):**
The trigger runs daily at 9:00 AM. Adjust the cron expression in the trigger node if needed.

**4. Campaign IDs:**
All campaign IDs are defined in the "Build API URLs" Code node. To add/remove campaigns, edit the `companyCampaignIds` and `peopleCampaignIds` arrays there AND in the two processing Code nodes.

**5. Test:**
Manually execute the workflow once to verify the data before activating.

**Note:** The API uses `id` + `ids` params. If that doesn't work, try changing to comma-separated `ids` only in the Build API URLs node.

## Setup Instructions

**1. Replace API Key:**
In both HTTP Request nodes ("Fetch Yesterday Stats" and "Fetch All Time Stats"), replace `YOUR_INSTANTLY_API_KEY` with your actual Instantly API key.

**2. Configure Slack:**
Connect your Slack credential to the "Send to Slack" node and set your target channel ID.

**3. Adjust Schedule (Optional):**
The trigger runs daily at 9:00 AM. Adjust the cron expression in the trigger node if needed.

**4. Campaign IDs:**
All campaign IDs are defined in the "Build API URLs" Code node. To add/remove campaigns, edit the `companyCampaignIds` and `peopleCampaignIds` arrays there AND in the two processing Code nodes.

**5. Test:**
Manually execute the workflow once to verify the data before activating.

**Note:** The API uses `id` + `ids` params. If that doesn't work, try changing to comma-separated `ids` only in the Build API URLs node.
